Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (fired red) with bands in added white; exterior, from top: painted decoration consisting of perhaps part of bull's hoof, to right, and part of rising triangle as filling ornament; below, double guilloche pattern on cul; below, two broken maeander bands bordered by black bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the bull's hoof, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20, no. 236.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (pl. 56, no. 411)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 98, no. 302.5, pl. 32, no. 302.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0233) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 210-1, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4645 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
